events.name: Friday Hacks #109 - Nativefier - Wrap any web page into an executable without even thinking
events.description:
For our fifth Friday Hacks of the semester, we’re having Jia Hao, an undergrad from SUTD to talk about his popular nativefier project.

Nativefier is an open source Node.js command line tool that allows you to easily create a desktop application for any web site with succinct and minimal configuration. Apps are wrapped by Electron in an OS executable for use on Windows, OSX and Linux. In this talk, Jia Hao will discuss the the architecture of Nativefier, and share a little about what he has learnt while working with Electron, which powers apps like Atom, Slack and more on the desktop. You can try it out here: https://github.com/jiahaog/nativefier

Speaker Profile

Jia Hao is a final year student at SUTD studying Information Systems Technology and Design (Computer Science). He enjoys experimenting and playing with upcoming technologies for the web, and building programs to automate menial tasks.

Free pizza as usual! 

http://nushackers.org/2016/03/friday-hacks-109-Mar-11

Friday Hacks is sponsored by the NUS Enterprise Center.

If you are looking to turn your ideas into a startup and would love some business support, feel free to get in touch with Agustiadi from NUS Enterprise: agustiadi@nus.edu.sg

events.name: UX TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates!
events.description:
Have you ever come across something new in UX, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper. Please bring a laptop or sketchbook. Join to level-up your design and research knowledge, meet other UXers, or learn about the methods used by designers and researchers at the venue. 


7:00 PM - Arrival, seating, & drinks  7:15 PM - Intro talk by the host  7:30 PM - R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new  9:00 PM - Q&A: share what your team learned  9:30 - 10:00 PM - The end

events.name: Bar.Foo
events.description: Like Kopi.JS but with alcohol. Bar.Foo is a casual meet up with no agenda, rhyme or reason other than to chat with local developers and designers. Bring a friend or meet some new ones!
events.location: Brauhaus Restuarant and Pub, 101 Thomson Road, #B1-13/14 United Square, Singapore

events.name: LearnSG Seed Fund for Maker Faire Showcase
events.description: Dear all, The Lifelong learning institute is extending an invitation to all makers to tap into the LearnSG Seed Fund to partially fund Maker Faire Singapore 2016 projects. Makers can apply for the fund if there is a community and learning component in their projects. Join us at the National Design Centre on the 11th March to find out more about the application process and eligibility.
events.location: National Design Centre, IDA labs - Level 3
